snippet: Alexander Dale Oen of Norway, the reigning world champion in the 100-meter breaststroke, died of cardiac arrest while in Flagstaff, Ariz., training with the Norwegian national team. He was 26.
abstract: Norwegian swimmer Alexander Dale Oen, 26-year-old reigning world champion in the 100-meter breaststroke, dies of cardiac arrest while training in Flagstaff, Ariz, for the 2012 Olympics. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: The breaststroker Michael Alexandrov looked up video of Alexander Dale Oen on YouTube last week. The United States Olympic trials are in June, and Alexandrov was studying Dale Oen's technique to see how to improve his own stroke. Alexandrov's training partners at the University of Southern California include Kosuke Kitajima, who is regarded as the best breaststroker in history, but Alexandrov considered Dale Oen, the reigning world champion in the 100-meter breaststroke, to be the man to beat at the London Games.

headline.main: Champion Swimmer Found Dead in Arizona
